revision.text:
{{otheruses}} {{Infobox given name | name = Pedro | image = | image_size = | caption = | pronunciation = {{IPA-es|ˈpeðɾo|lang}}
{{IPA-pt|ˈpedɾu, -ðɾu|lang}} | gender = Male | meaning = Rock | region = [[Spain]], [[Latin America]], [[Portugal]], [[The Philippines]] | language = [[Spanish language|Spanish]], [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] | origin = [[Saint Peter|Peter]] | alternative spelling = Pêro{{cn|date=June 2018}} | nickname = | variant forms = | related names = [[Peter (given name)|Peter]], [[Pierre]], [[Boutros]], | name day = | derived = | popularity = | footnotes = }} '''Pedro''' (alternate archaic spelling '''Pêro'''){{cn|date=June 2018}} is a masculine given name. Pedro is the [[Spanish language|Spanish]], [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]], and [[Galician language|Galician]] name for ''[[Peter (given name)|Peter]]''.[http://www.mfnames.com/mnames/p/origin-and-meaning-of-pedro.htm MFnames.com - Origin and Meaning of Pedro] Its French equivalent is [[Pierre]] while its English and Germanic form is Peter. The counterpart [[patronymic]] [[surname]] of the name Pedro, meaning "son of Peter" (compare with the English surname [[Peterson (name)|Peterson]]) is [[Pérez]] in Spanish, and [[Peres]] in Galician and Portuguese, [[Pires (disambiguation)|Pires]] also in Portuguese, and [[Peiris]] in coastal area of [[Sri Lanka]] (where it originated from the Portuguese version), with all ultimately meaning "son of Pêro". The name Pedro is derived via the Latin word "petra", from the Greek word "η πετρα" meaning "stone, rock".[http://www.mfnames.com/mnames/p/origin-and-meaning-of-peter.htm MFnames.com - Origin and Meaning of Peter] The name [[Peter (name)|Peter]] itself is a translation of the [[Aramaic language|Aramaic]] ''Kephas'' or ''[[Aramaic of Jesus#Cephas_.28.CE.9A.CE.B7.CF.86.CE.B1.CF.82.29|Cephas]]'' meaning "stone". '''Pedro''' may refer to: ==Notable people== ===Monarchs=== *[[Pedro I of Portugal]] *[[Pedro II of Portugal]] *[[Pedro III of Portugal]] *[[Pedro IV of Portugal]], also Pedro I of Brazil *[[Pedro V of Portugal]] *[[Pedro II of Brazil]] *[[Pedro of Castile]] *[[Peter I of Aragon and Navarre]], also known as Pedro I *[[Peter II of Aragon]] *[[Peter III of Aragon]] *[[Peter IV of Aragon]] *[[Peter V of Aragon]], also Pedro IV of Barcelona ===Politicians and leaders=== *[[Pedro Aguirre Cerda]], Chilean political figure *[[Pedro Atacho]], Curaçaoan politician *[[Pedro Eugenio Aramburu]], President of Argentina from 1955 to 1958 *[[Pedro Lascuráin]], President of Mexico *[[Pedro Nel Ospina]], Colombian general and political figure *[[Pedro Pablo Ramírez]], President of Argentina from 1943 to 1944 *[[Pedro Rosselló]], Governor of Puerto Rico from 1993 to 2001 *[[Pete Saenz|Pedro I. "Pete" Saenz]], American politician *[[José Pedro Pérez-Llorca]], Spanish politician *[[Pedro Sánchez (politician)|Pedro Sánchez]], [[Prime Minister of Spain]] since 2018 *[[Pedro Pablo Kuczynski]], [[President of Peru]] from 2016 to 2018 ===In sports=== *[[Pedro Acosta]], Venezuelan football player *[[Pedro Aroche]], Mexican race walker *[[José Pedro Azevedo Ferreira]], Portuguese football player known as Pedró *[[Pedro Chirivella]], Spanish football player *[[Pedro Collins]], West Indian cricketer *[[Pedro de la Rosa]], Spanish racing driver *[[Pedro Diniz]], Brazilian racing driver *[[Pedro Gil]], Spanish Roller hockey player *[[Pedro Gusmão]], Brazilian football player *[[Pedro Hernández Martínez]] (born 1978), Spanish football player *[[Pedro Iznaga]], Cuban volleyball player *[[Pedro Lamy]], Portuguese Grand Prix driver *[[Pedro Lima (swimmer)]] (born 1971), former Olympic swimmer from Angola *[[Pedro Lima (boxer)]] (born 1983), Brazilian boxer *[[Pedro Martínez]], American baseball player *[[Pedro Miguel Pauleta]], Portuguese football player *[[Pedro Morales]], Puerto Rican professional wrestler *[[Pedro Pérez]], Cuban triple jumper *[[Pedro Pineda]], Mexican football player *[[Pedro Rodríguez (disambiguation)]], Ecuadorian cyclist *[[Pedro Rodríguez (racing driver)]], Mexican Grand Prix racer *[[Pedro (footballer, born 1987)|Pedro Rodríguez Ledesma]] (born 1987), Spanish footballer *[[Pedro (footballer, born 1986)|Pedro Antonio Sánchez Moñino]] (born 1986), Spanish footballer *[[Pedro Santa Cecilia]] (born 1984), Spanish football player *[[Pedro Senatore Ramos]], Ecuadorian football referee *[[Pedro da Silva (athlete)]], Brazilian decathlete *[[Pedro Roberto Silva Botelho]], Brazilian footballer *[[Pedro Zabála]], Bolivian footballer ===Explorers=== *[[Pedro Álvares Cabral]], Portuguese navigator and explorer *[[Pedro Escobar]], Portuguese explorer who discovered São Tomé and Príncipe *[[Pedro Teixeira]], Portuguese explorer ===Other=== *[[Pedro Almodóvar]], Spanish filmmaker *[[Pedro de Ayala]], Spanish diplomat *[[Pedro Dimas]], Mexican musician *[[Pedro Duro]], Spanish businessman *[[Pedro Gomez (dance instructor)]], Cuban Salsa dance instructor *[[Pedro Gomez (sports reporter)]], American television reporter *[[Pedro López (disambiguation)]] *[[Pedro Nunes]], Portuguese mathematician *[[Pedro Páez]], Spanish Jesuit missionary in Ethiopia *[[Pedro Pascal]], Chilean-American actor *[[Pedro Reyes (comedian)]], Spanish comedian *[[Pedro Rodriguez (NASA)]], Puerto Rican scientist and inventor *[[Pedro Sousa, Portuguese comedian]] *[[Pedro Rodriguez (soldier)]], Puerto Rican Korean War hero *[[Prince Pedro Carlos of Orléans-Braganza]], claimant to the [[abolished monarchy|defunct]] Brazilian throne, and head of the [[Brazilian Imperial Family#The Petrópolis line|Petrópolis branch]] of the [[Imperial House of Brazil]] *[[Pedro Yap]], former Philippine Chief Justice *[[Pedro Zamora]], cast member on [[The Real World: San Francisco|The Real World]] *[[Peter of Saint Joseph de Betancur|Pedro de San José de Betancur]], was a Spanish saint and missionary in [[Guatemala]]. ==Fictional characters== *Pedro, from ''[[The Power of Five]]'' novel series by Anthony Horowitz *Pedro, a character from the ''[[One Piece]]'' manga series *Pedro, a character from the ''[[Excel Saga]]'' manga series *Don Pedro, a character from ''[[Much Ado About Nothing]]'', a comedy by William Shakespeare *Don Pedro, a character from the Philippine story ''[[Ibong Adarna (mythology)|Ibong Adarna]]'' *Pedro the Mail Burro, a mascot of the Boy Scouting magazine ''[[Boys' Life]]'' *Pedro Sanchez, the main character from the film ''[[Napoleon Dynamite]]'' *Pedro, another name of Panama Joe, a character from [[Montezuma's Revenge (video game)|''Montezuma's Revenge'' (video game)]] *Pedro, in the ''[[Sam & Max Season Two]]'' video game series *Pedro, a mascot of ''[[South of the Border (attraction)|South of the Border]] [[roadside attraction]]'' *Pedro, a Red-crested Cardinal from ''[[Rio (2011 film)|Rio]]'' *Pedro, the magician shapeshifter student boy by a folktale from ''[[Alamat (TV series)|Alamat]]'' *Pedro Pony, a character from the animated TV series [[Peppa Pig]] *Pedro Tute, a tute that fills the Chord part in Wii Music ==See also== *[[Pérez]] ==References== {{given name|Pedro}} [[Category:Spanish given names]] [[Category:Portuguese given names]]
